catapult.driver package¶

Submodules¶

catapult.driver.backends module¶

class catapult.driver.backends.Backend[source]¶

Bases: object

Abstract base class for backend-specific kernel compiler implementations.

This class defines the interface for backend-specific compiler wrappers. Implementations should handle the compilation of kernel code for specific hardware backends (e.g., CUDA, OpenCL, etc.).

Each backend implementation should provide methods to: 1. Create a compiler instance for a specific kernel 2. Check if the backend is available on the system 3. Launch the kernel on the backend

abstractmethod __init__() → None[source]¶

Initialize the backend compiler.

abstractmethod static get_compiler(source: str | bytes, name: str | bytes, calling_dir: str, device: int, compile_options: List[bytes] | None = None, num_headers: int | None = 0, headers: Tuple[bytes] | List[bytes] | None = None, include_names: Tuple[bytes] | List[bytes] | None = None, template_params: List[str] | None = None, method: str | None = 'ptx') → Compiler[source]¶

Create and return a compiler object for this backend.

Returns:

A compiler instance specific to this backend

(e.g., _NVRTCProgram for CUDA)

Return type:

Compiler

abstractmethod static get_name() → str[source]¶

Get the name of the backend.

Returns:

Name of the backend (e.g., ‘cuda’, ‘opencl’)

Return type:

str

abstractmethod static is_available() → bool[source]¶

Check if this backend is available on the current system.

Returns:

True if the backend is available, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

Launch the backend.

catapult.driver.framework module¶

class catapult.driver.framework.Framework[source]¶

Bases: object

Base abstract class for handling different computation frameworks.

This class provides an interface for framework-specific operations like data pointer parsing and device management. Implementations should handle framework-specific details (e.g., PyTorch, NumPy) while providing a consistent interface for kernel compilation and execution.

abstractmethod static clean_values(args) → Tuple[Tuple, Tuple][source]¶

Clean the Framework specific values in the input to easily parse and pass to the backend.

abstractmethod static get_available_targets() → List[str][source]¶

Get the target platform/backend for the framework.

Returns:

Identifier for the target platform (e.g., ‘cpu’).

Return type:

str

abstractmethod static get_name() → str[source]¶

Get the name of the framework.

Returns:

Name of the framework (e.g., ‘torch’, ‘numpy’).

Return type:

str

abstractmethod static is_active() → bool[source]¶

Check if the framework is available in the current environment.

Returns:

True if the framework is available, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

abstractmethod set_target(target: str) → None[source]¶

Set the target platform/backend for the framework.

Parameters:

target (str) – Identifier for the target platform (e.g., ‘cpu’).

class catapult.driver.framework.GPUFramework[source]¶

Bases: Framework

Abstract base class for GPU-specific framework implementations.

Extends the Framework class with GPU-specific operations like device management and stream handling. Used for frameworks that support GPU computation (e.g., PyTorch CUDA, CuPy).

abstractmethod static get_device() → int[source]¶

Get the current GPU device identifier.

Returns:

Current device identifier.

Return type:

str

abstractmethod static get_stream() → int[source]¶

Get the current CUDA stream.

Returns:

Current CUDA stream identifier.

Return type:

str

abstractmethod static set_device(device: str) → None[source]¶

Set the current GPU device.

Parameters:

device (str) – Device identifier to set as current.

class catapult.driver.Backend[source]¶

Bases: object

Abstract base class for backend-specific kernel compiler implementations.

This class defines the interface for backend-specific compiler wrappers. Implementations should handle the compilation of kernel code for specific hardware backends (e.g., CUDA, OpenCL, etc.).

Each backend implementation should provide methods to: 1. Create a compiler instance for a specific kernel 2. Check if the backend is available on the system 3. Launch the kernel on the backend

class catapult.driver.Framework[source]¶

Bases: object

Base abstract class for handling different computation frameworks.

This class provides an interface for framework-specific operations like data pointer parsing and device management. Implementations should handle framework-specific details (e.g., PyTorch, NumPy) while providing a consistent interface for kernel compilation and execution.
